intro: Brachyrhynchos albicaulis, commonly known as the white-stemmed brachyrhynchos, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and generally herbaceous growth habit. The plant features slender, erect stems covered in a fine, white pubescence, which gives it its common name. Its leaves are typically narrow and lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Brachyrhynchos albicaulis is often found in open grasslands and disturbed sites, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
